articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It is gone. A giant, glowing X no longer marks the spot on the San Francisco high-rise that is headquarters to Elon Musk's messaging company X, formerly known as Twitter.
articles.title: Big X taken down from Twitter roof after San Francisco squabble

articles.author: Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Economic sanctions have been the biggest headache for Russia's business elite since the start of the war in Ukraine, but a drone strike in the heart of Moscow's financial district is forcing companies to think about their employees' safety.
articles.title: War comes to Russian business after drones strike Moscow's financial centre

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cash-strapped U.S. trucking company Yellow Corp (YELL.O) has ceased operations and is filing for bankruptcy after failing to reorganize and refinance over a billion dollars in debt, the Teamsters Union said on Sunday.
articles.title: US trucking firm Yellow shuts ops, to file for bankruptcy, Teamsters say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's factory activity contracted at a faster pace in July, a business survey showed on Tuesday, taking a hit from soft orders amid weakening global economic conditions.
articles.title: Japan's factory activity falls on soft orders - PMI

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Chinese property giant Country Garden (2007.HK) plunged as much as 10.8% in early trading on Tuesday after it scrapped a share placement to raise $300 million.
articles.title: Country Garden shares slump after share sale scrapped

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Frank Siragusa was not happy that the Mexican Pizza he paid $5.49 for at a Taco Bell in New York City last September appeared to contain only half as much beef and bean filling as the photo in the chain's advertising. So he sued.
articles.title: Taco Bell is sued for false advertising of Crunchwraps, Mexican pizzas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China on Monday announced export controls on some drone-related equipment, saying it wanted to safeguard "national security and interests" amid escalating tension with the United States over access to technology.
articles.title: China curbs exports of drone-related equipment amid U.S. tech tension

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets
articles.description: They rode into a kill zone. The timing was off. Many men were lost. In the end, they recaptured the ruined village of Staromaiorske, claiming Ukraine's biggest advance for weeks.
articles.title: 'The Russians were waiting for us': Ukraine troops describe tougher fight than expected

articles.author: Mariano Zafra
articles.description: How concrete, asphalt and urban heat islands add to the misery of heat waves
articles.title: How concrete, asphalt and urban heat islands add to the misery of heat waves

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Paul Reubens, the actor who played Pee-wee Herman, a nerdy character who wore a gray suit and red bowtie while delighting children and adults alike with his distinctive "heh heh heh" laugh, has died, a post on his Instagram account said on Monday.
articles.title: Paul Reubens, actor who played Pee-wee Herman, dies at 70
